Also was woen at 12am, 6am, 7am and then 8am with other guests/cleaners banging their doors in and out of the rooms! I have slept better in a holiday Inn and when you are paying top dollar you expect to sleep as thats the most important thing! Good points:- The Italian restaurant, The pool area and the decor However would not stay here again because of lack of quality sleep but will go back to The Beverly Hills Hotel or try The Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Sedate, Good Location, Private”
Reviews.Author: ExpectGreat
Reviews.Content: A good location and quiet place to stay convenient to West L.A, while avoiding the congestion of downtown Beverly Hills and of Sunset Boulevard. I have stayed regularly for several years. The service is inconsistent, slow and sometimes unduly rude or inept, not up to par for Four Seasons, though the prices are certainly high for services and room service. The beds often are not the size claimed... they do have real king beds in some suites, but often despite claiming it's a king they try to give you a queen, and bed's often are squeaky or have sunken mattresses. The swimming pool deck can be a nice spot to work.

Reviews.Title: “Last Word In Service”
Reviews.Author: KeefRichards_London
Reviews.Content: The four seasons is conveniently located on Doheny Drive and well placed for shopoholics. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and they have the last word in service. Th entrance is very fairytale and you walk through two pretty oudoor old style heaters and into a cool, elegantly lit and dressed lobby. Thecstaff are at your beck and call and they are doing a lot of the thinking for you. For example, they ask you if you would like a late check out and do not charge extra, knowing that you might be catching a late flight. The rooms are divine and all come with a balcony with a view at the front of hotel that overlooks the city with The Hills in the background. Hotel ameneties come no better than the fourth floor spa/gym/pool complex. The pool is outdoor and heated and large enough not to feel crowded. You can finish off your swim or workout in the heated hot tub and be served your favourite drink without moving a step. It's an expensive choice but is the epitomy of luxury and definitely worth grabbing a night or two slimming it with the rich and famous!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch place for Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: Spent my thrid Christmas at the FSLA and it was a delight, as usual. The location is quiet and the hotel is not a "scene" like the Beverly Hills Hotel can be. Don't get me wrong, BHH is fine, but for Christmas, The Four Seasons is tradition and perfect. Rooms: Usually take a two bedroom suite for the holidays and this time was no different than the others. Typical Four Seasons: Bright, spacious, well appointed and spotless with big flat screens and great linens and bath products. Service: Pretty much perfect. The desk, valet, bell and concierge staff were on the spot and pleasant. House car was always available for dinner runs (try Lucques on Melrose) and Rodeo for shopping.Given that it was Christmas, this was particularly appreciated. Food: Great! Did the holiday buffet which was really good, as always. They are doing renovations in the restaurant so the display wasn't quite as lavish as times past. Nevertheless, it was bountiful and enjoyable. The Bar/Lounge is a great place to hang out, enjoy a drink and celebrity watch. In all, this is a fine place to spend a few days. I have stayed in the area at most of the best hotels (Bel Air, Beverly Hills, Peninsula, etc.) and this is one of my favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Well located with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this hotel when they were 100% booked and yet never felt like the staff was over-extended or unavailable. The rooms were typical of a Four Seasons and very nice. The bed was quite comfortable and the furnishings were up to date. We had two rooms, both with balconies and nice views. The rooms had an iPod dock, though it would not recharge a device. The bathrooms were very nice with large bathtubs and a door between the tub/shower and the vanity/sink area. The towels were plentiful and nice. Wifi was available for a nominal fee. Each room also had a small, but well equipped in-room bar. The hotel also had a nice work-out facility though it is outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it<3”
Reviews.Author: sayuri187
Reviews.Content: this my was first time staying at this hotel.. i came to meet my parents in L.A and we stayed for 3 nights total.. when we first arrived everyone greeted us with smiles being very polite always welcoming us back after being out.. i think that the rate i paid 515 per night was a very reasonable price for the room we stayed in ..it was big bed was big for 3 allthough we had an extra bed brought up to us bathroom was big clean towels everyday even twice a day.. flatscreen in bathroom ..bvlgari shampoo soap and etc.. room was clan balcony nice.. breakfast was really nice roomservice we used every morning to have coffee sent to the room they were fast.. i totally lved it it was most def a 5 star to me..luxury without being snobbish.. i cant wait to go back .....;)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: ivylauren
Reviews.Content: It was great! The hotel was very nice & the people were very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LibbyCawthorne
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LA and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. In fact when we come back this will be the only hotel we would stay in. From the moment you arrive it is pure luxury. The hotel and all of the staff are marvellous. Nothing was too much trouble and service was of the highest order. The pool area is beautiful and the staff there are really attentive. The hotel has an outside bar terrace on the ground floor where smoking is allowed!! As smokers we had expected not to be able to smoke in LA, and were pleasantly surprised to be able to enjoy our drink and a smoke along with many other smokers! The hotel operates a courtesy car, which will take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius. We used the car many times and had no problems getting this service. The drivers were very polite and most helpful. We visited the sister hotel the Beverley Wiltshire which was beautiful, but we did feel the Four Seasons was just that bit better even though the Beverley Wiltshire is well positioned right at the bottom of Rodeo Drive. We dined one night at Mr Chow's and the food and the atmosphere were brilliant - though not cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “best service in the world”
Reviews.Author: apollofilms
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons consistently provides the best service of any hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 5-star experience”
Reviews.Author: RoundZ09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February of 2009. The Four Seasons BH is, as you might expect, an exceptionally nice 5-star hotel. Rooms are very comfortable, service is attentive. I like the location very much -- a residential neighborhood that's quiet, but with good access to surrounding area -- but some may prefer a more central location near commercial areas such as Wilshire Boulevard, etc. All and all it's a very nice hotel, nice rooftop pool, very luxurious and comfortable. The only mild reservation â€“ it doesn't have a whole lot of character if that matters to you. I tend to prefer the Sunset Towers on Sunset Boulevard, which has loads of character, but, again, The Four Seasons BH is a great place in a lot of ways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: passeportLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights, the pool was shut for refurbishment, but we had access to the Raffles Hermitage pool a short distance away, everything was perfect as usual, the staff make you feel totally at home and cannot do enough for you. The concierge desk is exceptional, and the valet parking boys could'n t be more helpful. Enjoyed everything, they are bit by bit updating the hotel, but regardless of the age of the tv, it is the service at the end of the day that keeps me coming back. This was my third stay there, I have stayed at the Beverley Hills Hotel and the Chateau Marmont but this is still way ahead of all of them for sheer class.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: MrsWaterhouse
Reviews.Content: Great bar, great pool area and superb concierge. The spa is really wonderful and the poolside service and drinks/snacks are excellent. Room service perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Same Four Seasons experience but rooms a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Derektravels
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a quick one-nighter. This Four Seasons is everything Four Seasons is about except for one thing. The room decor is very tired looking. Nice bathroom with fresh orchids and marble top but the armoire was a very dull old wood and there was a regular TV in it and an old JVC boombox! This is 2009 for crying out loud. Besides the room being this way, the service was impeccable and everything else was beyond my expectations as it always is at any Four Seasons. I was told the room decor is 21 years old and they're hoping for a rennovation starting in June which keeps getting pushed back.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing”
Reviews.Author: 9o21o
Reviews.Content: Is it possible to marry a hotel? If so, I'd marry this one. The staff were so friendly, service was brilliant, the hotel itself was beautiful and the breakfast was particularly lovely. On the first night of our stay we were given complimentary candy floss after dinner! Loved it, loved it, LOVED IT :D Go, everyone! GO!!!! xxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place but........”
Reviews.Author: getupandgoChicago
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this hotel is an absolutely great place to stay. For the price, however, there were several missing elements. WI-FI was problematic, valet lost my car for 30 minutes and an afternoon "tea for two" cost over $100.00. As far as the room goes, everything worked (except the wi-fi) and was comfortable but the room seemed to be old and worn. Again, it was fine but not up to expectation. The room was clean but it was not 100% clean. There was dust, the toilet surface was clean but not under and behind the seat, the remote had something on it and all mirrors had streaks. There were also 3 pieces of paper under the bed. I really did not mind all of these problems but I did not expect to find them at this hotel. I have stayed at hotels below $100/night which were perfectly sanitized and that is what I would expect at the 4-S. It would be easy for me to write a long list of the good features of this hotel. It is a great place. I do believe, however, that these issues are important.

Reviews.Title: “Brief visit to LA”
Reviews.Author: Travis D
Reviews.Content: While definitely a Four Seasons, luxurious in terms of attentive staff upon arrival, fancy cars in the drive and everyone arriving by limo or town car, the haute-couture vibe was in the air. Sadly, it wasn't that amazing of a hotel beyond the elusive entrance. While I don't necessarily have complaints, it wasn't (for the price!) that fantastic of a stay nor would I want to stay there again when I'm in Los Angeles or Beverly Hills area. There were problems with the internet upon arriving, which could not be accessed either by wireless or wired connections. This was not resolved until the following evening. The breakfast via room service was fantastic and I still dream about it to this day. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room (a suite) was quite spacious. Unfortunately, my room was not made available for check-in until nearly 6 p.m. but I was traveling with a friend whose room was available when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: bluechick33
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for work (how else could I afford it!?) It was like a step back in times - in a good way. once you step into the hotel, it does not feel like modern LA at all. The staff were courteous, I had a parcel waiting for me, but had to ask for it at the concierge. The hotel was in a quiet part of tonwn, not where all the action is, but the great thing is that they provide free limo service to the nearby malls - Beverly Hills Centre and an open-air shopping area that I can't remember the name of (see pictures). Take a name card from the ultra-friendly driver, and call him when you're done shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Nice...”
Reviews.Author: BusinessJeffJet
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. The rooms are classy and marble bathrooms are a nice touch. One of my favorite things is eating in the Window's Lounge for some of the best people watching in Los Angeles. A little overpriced, but hey it's the Four Seasons! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Simply.....Amazing”
Reviews.Author: annanewzealand
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many trips and I have enjoyed it every single time. There are so many superlatives for this hotel I dont know where to start. It isnt that the hotel itself is the most beautiful or stylish or has the best up to date facilities. It is simply that in my view it has some of the best staff I have encountered, the most wonderful room service food I have ever eaten, the best hotel bar I have ever had a drink in, the best hotel restaurant food I have had and the most child friendly hotel i have ever had the pleasure of staying in. It is like a wonderful oasis of calm and tranquility, with the smell of lilies and frangipani in the air, right in the middle of Beverly Hills. I just love this hotel, and although expensive, i think it is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah but no...wasn't really feeling it...”
Reviews.Author: KCZUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FS Beverly Hills for 2 nights, following a relaxing weekend at a place on the beach at Santa Monica. The location was great cos we wanted to go to various restaurants and clubs that were slightly out of reach when staying at Santa Monica, and that was the main reason for us staying here. I have to admit, after staying at the beach and getting into nice relaxed holiday mode, I was not really feeling the "high tower" "rows upon rows of balconies on the mainstreet" type of hotel, and I was so un-enamoured with it that I realised upon leaving I hadn't taken a single photo of the place! It was of course, as you would expect from the FS, very well-presented, but the room we had (1523 I think) was quite old-school, badly in need of a refurb (although everything was in good condition, it just needed a facelift). Bathroom was nice and big, and I believe the valet parking is included - they also give you some nice Voss water when waiting on the car which is nice! Overall it was great on location, with friendly efficient service but that's it really. It wasn't at all charming in any sense of the word, and I like hotels that have a bit of character - you can be a luxury hotel without being bland! So not very memorable. The pool area was small and unfort they had building work (going on since MAY!!) which they kept quiet of course (when we were booking that is!), so that's what I mean when I say yeah but no...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, But...”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: I typically stay elsewhere in the LA area, but I was traveling with a wealthy business associate that wanted to stay here, and it made it much easier for me to stay here as well. Four Seasons hotels are known for their service, and this location is no exception. The front desk staff was efficient and professional, the concierge was helpful--everyone that I came in contact with was outgoing and friendly. The bed was comfortable and the bedside Bose Wave radio was a nice touch. However, as others have noted, the facilities are in desperate need of renovation. Instead of new and modern, you will receive a room with worn bathroom counters and fixtures, old style tube TVs in the bedroom (27") and bathroom (13") and tired furniture. While I prefer hotels that offer classic luxury, the term that comes to mind here isn't 'classic' but 'fossilized'--I got the distinct impression that this location is being run as a cash cow, using the Four Seasons name to charge confiscatory rates, while investing the bare minimum on the facilities. If service is your highest priority and price is no object, then this is the place for you. However, if you are looking for the total package (service and amenities in proportion to the price charged), look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: nomayo4me
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently booked a room at this Hotel and were quite pleased. It is a very plush hotel. This is not a place for the budget concious traveler, but is great for a romantic get away. We purchased tickets to :WIcked". The next day we took in the La Brea Tar Pits, and the Grifiths Observatory. The entire weekend was one of the best experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: ekferszt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Bev Hills Four Seasons for work. The check in was extremely smooth, the staff is all very courteous and attentive. They try not to make you wait ever, they open doors, always say good morning. Attentive without being invasive. Good example is that I asked for an adapter for my computer. In most hotels it takes 20 minutes to get, but within 3 minutes they had already brought it to my door. The decor is very LA 1980's. While very lavish and opulent, it's certainly not modern, design and stylish. They do have a beautiful garden and there's always these enormous, beautiful floral arrangements everywhere. They upgraded my room so I was staying in an executive suite. The room was huge, the bathroom as well. The decor is classic 4 Seasons. Pale green, old English furniture. Going back to the 1980's comment, I had 2 old school TV's in my room with a VHS player. I didn't even think they made VHS anymore. They did have an ipod dock in the BOSE alarm clock - but that's really the only modern amenity in the room. Food is quite good - I only had breakfast (once in the garden and once in the pool) but it was delicious. The pool is beautiful and a great place to hang out, but the pool water was really hot. Jumping in you definitely didn't cool off from the humidity outside. Fitness center is nice and up to date with the latest equipment. It's outdoors so whatever temperature it is outside is the temperature you're working out in. It sometimes got insanely hot. I could only really work out in the morning. Spa is great, well taken care of with excellent attentive staff and all amenities post-work out or post treatment. It is in the heart of Bev Hills so expect a bit of excess all around. Saturday morning is a parade of Escalades, Porsche's, Rolls Royce and what not. But it's all part of the LA show. All in all, had a really nice stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Four Seasons Beverly Hills”
Reviews.Author: cjmillar99
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Four Seasons on Doheny in Los Angeles - first time there, had a really amazing experience. Usually stay down by the beach but colleagues had recommended this Four Seasons next time I visit LA. Two things that stand out, exceptional service and genuine warmth from the staff, so many smiling faces. Felt at home, felt pampered and to be honest did not want to get on that long flight home. Oh being British, its nice to know that they have a British chef who has the best fish and chips on the menu. Really didn't want to leave but I know Ill be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, Horrible, rude service”
Reviews.Author: mcwedding
Reviews.Content: Been meaning to write a review for a while. Although this is a beautiful hotel with nice spa and gym, I hate staying here. I've stayed here about 4 times in the past 2 years, usually for 5 days at a time. You would think they would treat us decently, but they are snobby and inefficient. During one stay we had arrived early, and my husband had to go to a work meeting, leaving me in the lobby awaiting the keys to the room. This snooty blonde (nothing against blondes, I'm blonde myself), told me that someone was just cleaning my room and it would be ready shortly. I waited for 2 hours, write in front of her face, sitting in the chair in front of the desk. She was well aware that I had just gotten off a long flight from florida, and wasnt feeling well. I watched as she and some other guy flirted, while I waited for my room to be cleaned. When she called room service the second time she found out that my room was ready, as I overheard the conversation, and I walked up to the desk to get my key, but she "acted busy" then made a phone call while I stood there waiting to get my key. I actually didnt get to check into my room until 20 minutes after check-in time, because of the slow service. Call me crazy, but it seemed as though she was being a b...on purpose. They have NEVER let us check in even 15 minutes before their check in time..we actually paid an entire nights fee to check in at 8 am because we were flying in on an early flight from Hawaii and figured they sure as heck wouldn't let us check in THAT early. (Although we asked) On another occasion, I walked into my room when it was clearly in the process of being serviced, however, I sat at my computer to work, and realized the maid was nowhere to be found, she left my room a disaster, vacume in the middle of the floor, wet towels in the walkway, sheets halfway off my bed. She didn't come back for 45 minutes The gym here is rarely serviced, even though they are supposed to have an attendant. I've yet to be there when there was actually water in the water dispenser, or clean towels by the machines. For a Four seasons and the price, their service and the way they treat people is unacceptable. I wouldn't bother staying here unless your a celebrity because they seem to be the only hotel guests the hotel will treat properly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-Beagle
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it is just because I was expecting more but I was not impressed. The exterior of the hotel is nothing special and the lobby is modest in size. The bathroom decor is very dated (marble colours from the seventies) along with a small 15 year old tv. While the room size was comfortable it was not large. The workout facilities were strikingly bad - particularly for a Four Seasons. The workout facility was probably the worst that I have seen at any hotel in the last five years. The staff recognized this deficiency and noted that it was expected to be upgraded shortly. I do not personally care about seeing celebrities or being treated like a celebrity so those aspects of the hotel do not appeal to me. Overall it is not a great physical speciman of a hotel - simply not one of Four Seasons better properties. While the staff were good (and this is worth noting and commending) the property was really nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Best Welcome, Best Sleep, Best Spa, Best Bar, Best Overall”
Reviews.Author: Switched_On_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I gotta' admit that when you make it through the walled entrance after passing through the paparazzi poised for their best celebrity shot in front of the Four Seasons in Los Angeles, you too feel like a star. BEST WELCOME I have stayed at the property a number of times and always call it my home away from home and for good reason. Like in my more recent visit in March 2008, I could not find a hotel employee who did not personally say hello and smile. I am truly curious how this luxury property has figured out how to get their entire staff on the same page of perfection with regard to service. They are just warm and artfully tuned into the guest experience. Remembering the slightest detail is not just their focus for me...but you can sit and watch the same level of intimate touch happening around you if you just hang and watch. They just get it. BEST SLEEP I have rested my head on virtual every luxury brand's bed and pillow in North America and beyond. When I lay my head down here, I can't put my finger on what it is exactly, but I know one thing for certain that I never forget about this hotel. I sleep better here than anywhere else on the planet. BEST SPA I think this is exactly what Goldie Locks meant when she said "just right". Intimate, refined, understated elegance and massage therapists who have proven to be the best. It's location on the 4th floor of the property keeps it feeling very private and secluded. Just on the other side of the spa is the pool and an outdoor restaurant. My favorite thing to do is to stretch out on the comfie pool chair with a friend and pretend I live like this everyday..a pool attendant and staff bringing you drinks and food from the restaurant..walking by to spritz some evian spray and offer a cool towel on a hot day. It's hard to believe you are right inside L.A. because it feels like paradise. BEST BAR Extensive wine list and wines by the glass plus a thoughtful menu and excellent food that make this an easy spot to grab a light bite along with laughs with friends. (Though the restaurant and outdoor terrace dining on site from their amazing chef ashley is one of L.A.'s best kept secrets.) It's also the spot in town for power drinks and power meetings and it shows. If I grab a drink at the bar alone, I inevitably end up meeting interesting people without ever trying hard. BEST OVERALL It is rare to be able to experience such a refuge of luxury in any major city that at the same time makes you feel like you are at home with friends. Service leads this LA mainstay on the luxury hotel scene. God, I hope this is what heaven is like.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7714
Reviews.Content: I was able to stay at the Four Seasons for free because of a movie junket so price didn't play a factor in my stay. When I arrived I felt like a king because I was constantly greeted with warm smiles by people who appeared genuinely concerned about me enjoying my stay. I ordered steak from room service and it was one of (if not the best) steaks I have ever eaten in my life. If you want to feel like royalty, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Stay, Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: LamoWife
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Season in late September. We walked in to top notch staffing from the moment we handed over the keys to the valet. We were thrilled to hear our room was on the top floor. We arrived a little before check in and found no problem heading right to our room. The room was beautiful!!! We had double french doors leading out to our balcony. Light fresh colors highlighted the room. The bathroom was very large with wonderful little goodies. The entertainment center came with CD's of Fergie, Sting, etc. The bed was perfect. I didn' want to leave. The pool was on the small side but beautifully manicured on the fourth floor. The bar was high priced (of course), like $13.00 drinks. The location is near the famous Robertson Avenue which has great drinks and decent prices (for Beverly Hills). Just do not walk at night. I made the mistake of coming back to the room after the sun set and I had to play hopskotch with bugs on the sidewalks (roaches). Something I never seen before...on the street!!! Gross!!! Oh... the sunset from the room is something I would never forget. Absolutly beautiful over the city and moutains. Can't wait to go back... when the price works. I just have to stay off of the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful every time”
Reviews.Author: SWTTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: I live in Los Angeles and my girlfriends and I spend one weekend per year at this hotel for a shopping weekend. It really cannot be beat in my opinion (and I have stayed at many hotels in the area including the other Four Seasons). The rooms are luxurious, the bar is fun, you will see stars if that's your thing, the service is excellent, the room service food is even delicious. Best of all, you can go shopping all day and the house car (which by the way is a Phantom) will pick you up and take you to your next spot. This hotel is located perfectly for all shopping and eating in Beverly Hills - close to Wilshire, Beverly and Robertson shopping.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: spiderback
Reviews.Content: Spent four days over Xmas and had a great time. This place is subtle, well done and comfortable. check in flawless grand premiere suite as displayed on web great food quiet nice xmas brunch (expensive but worth it) great staff only negative was the bathroom. if you are short, like me, be very careful getting in. terrific staff.. checked out to go home and decided to stay over at the last minute to check back in. The welcome back was easy and kind. Called lost and found for a left behind book and was attended to promptly. some of the best room service food. one of the best hotels if not the best in or near bh.. i suggest a higher floor because of the potential noise but thats just a personal thing. well done

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: alcanhodge
Reviews.Content: While at the Four Seasons Los Angeles in Beverly Hills, I stayed in an Executive Suite on the 10th floor. I had a balcony, overlooking the city. As soon as I arrived, I was treated with the utmost respect and politeness. Everyone on the staff was pleasant, and willing to do whatever it took to make my stay the best it could be. The food was excellent; and the 24-hour room service was a plus, especially when travelling from the East coast and having to switch time zones. My room was always thoroughly clean and tidy, and the turn-down service was a nice end to a long work day. The beds were also very comfortable, along with the pillows. The location was great because Wilshire Blvd is just a few blocks away, which leads to many businesses in Beverly Hills. However, the hotel is tucked nicely away amongst what appeared to be residential buildings, so the noise level is not bothersome. It's quiet at night, and peaceful during the day. All in all, after being at the Four Seasons for a week, I was very pleased with my experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any traveler coming to Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: meestoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons one night before and after catching a cruise in Los Angeles and found the hotel to be fantastic, the place was beautiful and we were treated like royalty, the staff were very nice and the use of the house car was an extra bonus. I don't know why some of the other reviews were so bad, but I have to say in my opinion it was one of the best hotels I've stayed at. Even ran into some celebrities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tschatz
Reviews.Content: For the price, there are much better hotels in L.A. or Beverly Hills. The rooms are old and a little run down, beds sag in the middle; the televisions are ancient. The best part of the hotel room was the large bathroom. The "fitness center" consists of a few old machines and treadmills. While the concierge recommended two Italian restaurants within walking distance, the one we chose (Orso) had to be the inferior choice. She at least should have known the menu and wine list were very limited, which is unusual for Italian restaurants. We were at the hotel for a wedding; the outside garden is a great location for events, and the use of both outside and inside for the reception was well done. Speaking of being done, my fish at dinner was not, but it was not worth sending it back as I had enough appetizers to make up for the uncooked main course (filling up on appetizers being a wise decision at most weddings). When you try to find the hotel, make sure you know it is in L.A., not Beverly Hills, as there is a S. Doheny Drive in both cities. This is north of Wilshire Boulevard, and north of N. Doheny Drive in Beverly Hills (it makes more sense when you get there). There is a lot to do within walking distance, especially on Robertson Blvd. We stayed three nights at the Four Seasons after one night at the Beverly Hilton and were sorry we had to move from the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “needs a massive renovation”
Reviews.Author: pianorlh
Reviews.Content: I scour the world to find beautiful hotels for our travels. I often rely on the Four Seasons brand. I did so for our trip to LA during the week of July 4th. Unfortunately, the hotel did not meet my expectations. While checking in, a staff member at the reception desk warned me that the hotel would be a disappointment if I were expecting a typical Four Season facility. I took a look at the room and the furniture, carpets, fixtures and bathrooms were old, tired, banged up, stained and in need of renovation. The staff was very accomodating and understanding (they moved us to a suite) but the experience was unacceptable. We moved the next morning to the Peninsula-Beverly Hills, which is a spectacular facility in a much better location, with a very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Paula V
Reviews.Content: We had a local mini-vacation at the Four Seasons and it was wonderful. Beautiful, clean, great service, stocked refrigerator. I was very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, housekeeping needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: lulu90
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed in this hotel and have to say is one of my favorites. Very lay back, private and lots of celebrities I have seen there. Althought everything was almost perfect I have to admit the housekeeping was somewhat not to Four Seasons standards. Since I stayed in an executive suite which came with a sofa bed for my kids I asked the rollaway to be removed cause was not needed. I called 2 times and they never came to remove it. I went shopping in the morning and came back at 3 pm to find my room hadn't been made yet so I had to call to remind them. I had to say they apologized and came right away to do the room though which was nice. This housekeeping problem has never happened to me before in any other Four Seasons I have stayed. Overall the stay was great, friendly ,nice, service.The restaurants are great and so is the service.I'm not a celebrity but was treated like one. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “solid four stars, not five”
Reviews.Author: asiandude
Reviews.Content: minus': street side rooms somewhat noisy because of older french doors (doheney st. definitely not a cow path); unfathamably old t.v.; smallish room and bath; rather scrubby institutional towels; 10 bucks for internet; dinner in "fine dining" tres aveage and quite over salted. check out failed to give $60.00 food credit both to me and the gentleman checking out next to me. oh yea, the gym and spa are very dated and not all that pleasant to be in. plus': good service if somewhat impersonal; nice beds and bedding; fast room service; relatively cheap for a four seasons hotel; nice bath room amenities; decent location; nice west sun on street side.

Reviews.Title: “an almost perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: NY Tripster
Reviews.Content: Great staff: friendly and courteous as well as helpful. Maintenance quickly responded and fixed a minor problem. Dining was excellent. As to the location, there's no such thing as a good location in L.A. but this was as good as it can get. One small problem: The cocktail lounge was overcrowded and way too noisy to have a civil conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service for an old lady”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled99
Reviews.Content: The hotel building is old. As you approach it , you can see the architecture went out of fashion some time ago. The pool is painted and old fashioned in style. There was construction activity across the road, which should have been brought to my attention or in some other way compensated for. However in the 5 days I was there it only started once at 7:30 am and then sproradically on weekdays. it was a nuisance. But thats all thats negative. This is a GREAT hotel. The service is impeccable. Each person has been trained. The food is outstanding (especially the Sunday brunch). The pool was a bit busy on the weekend, but thats due to the fact that it is small relative to the size of the hotel. And you definitely dont notice that its an old building. The maintenance is good. We had breakfast each morning on the patio and could easily have been in acres of garden. The setting is tremendous and you do get to see stars. One day we saw four easily recognizable major actors. The hotel is located in a residential part of Beverley Hills so expect to walk or use the hotel's Rolls if you want to go places. But thats LA for you. if you want to stay in a more pedestrian area, Four Seasons has another hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “They Read Your Mind”
Reviews.Author: pfitz
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed three nights at the Four Seasons in an Executive Suite. I can't even begin to tell you how much we enjoyed ourselves. From the moment we checked out, the service was outstanding. The bellman, while dropping our luggage off at our room, suggested a place for dinner and contacted the concierge for reservations. The service at the restuarants was top notch. The Four Seasons provides complimentary car service within a two mile radius of the hotel making getting around town very easy The rooms were beautifully appointed and the common areas just as nice. My husband and son used the work out facility and liked the fact that it was outside but covered by a tent. The staff seemed to 'read our mind" and anticipate every need we had.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappoinment!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on business recently and was so disappointed! I've heard there are many famous faces who stay there. Well, I am not famous and I'm guessing that is why I received the substandard service that I did. Upon check in there was no bellman available. The bellman delivered the luggage about 15 minutes later. He did not offer any explanation of the room, nor did he point out fire exits, but I beleive he was in rush as one of the elevators was out of order and he seemed backed up. The room service order was cold. An order for one person is usually delivered on a tray. This was delivered on a table with one lonely plate in the middle, not even any flowers. Quite disappointing. The worst part of my stay was when I did not receive my wake-up call in the morning and missed my flight! An apology was offered by the doorman as I left the hotel, but no one in management has apologized. Truly disappointing. I highly recommend staying elsewhere when in LA. I won't be back........
